13,66860481,Which fields in my database diagram should I separate into relation tables?,"I am struggling with the issue of trying to understand whether or not data should be separated into different tables or kept within the same, in a database logical diagram.
My database is split into 3 parts: users (can be registered users who can post, view or like recipes
column2: and admins who review published recipes and can accept or block users), recipes (which contains data like: dish name, category, dificulty, duration, servings, execution, view count and state) and ingredients.

column1: Recipes and ingredients have a many : many relationship so I have connected those two with a relation table called &quot

Users to recipes has a 1 : many relationship (one user can create many recipes, but each recipe can only be created by one user), but also a relation table connecting them because of the favorites section (i.e. one user can have many recipes as favorite, and each recipe can also be flagged as favorite by many users).

But my actual problem is: I have separated from the table recipes a few fields (see image below for reference) such as Category, dificulty, and state. Is this acceptable or are these fields better off kept within table recipes?
[Photo of what I have so far, for reference][1]
Sorry for the long message. Thank you so much for your help!

column1: 26,66862168,Implicit RPM Issue: Directories not explicitly included in package:,"I am building an RPM package for a python web service called `pello`. The application is already compiled into a `.pyz` using `shiv` with the necessary dependencies required at runtime.
My target install directory is `/usr/bin` which is where the `pello.pyz` file will be located.
Here are files I am using to create the RPM.
`pello_build.sh` - Responsible for compiling python source into bytecode as a single `.pyz` file.
`pello.spec` - The RPM spec file used to package the RPM
`output` - The output I receive when attempting to install the built RPM.
These files are executed sequentially in the order listed. I believe there is an issue where `Directories not explicitly included in package` is printed.

My question: What am I doing wrong here? After this runs I see `exit 0` which looks good but I cannot find `pello.pyz` in the `/usr/bin` directory. It successfully exists with exit code 0, but `pello.pyz` is not in `/usr/bin`.
